channel.title: US Top News and Analysis
channel.description: CNBC is the world leader in business news and real-time financial market coverage. Find fast, actionable information.

item.title: The resilient stock market may be keeping the economy out of a recession. Why that's a bad thing
item.description: Consumers with larger stock holdings are feeling fine, while those with smaller or no holdings are not.

item.title: President Trump posts cartoon image depicting him firing Fed Chief Powell
item.description: Trump has repeatedly criticized Powell for his cautious approach to cutting interest rates, nicknaming him "Too Late Powell."

item.title: How a 'nudify' site turned a group of friends into key figures in a fight against AI-generated porn
item.description: A group of friends in Minnesota last year learned that a man they knew had used their social media photos to create pornographic deepfakes.

item.title: 'Seconds count': Avoiding airplane collisions at airports could come down to cockpit alerts
item.description: Honeywell is developing a series of new cockpit alerts aimed at preventing collisions at or around airports.

item.title: How to know when it's time to worry about the AI bubble
item.description: Wall Street is undergoing a minor AI-nxiety attack.

item.title: These stocks including an industrial giant are close to forming a dreaded 'death cross' chart pattern
item.description: Several publicly traded companies' stocks are on the verge of forming a technical pattern that signals trouble ahead.

item.title: 10 tons, built in seven days, and maybe a way to restore American Dream of affordable home ownership
item.description: Can modular housing revive the American Dream of affordable home ownership? One homebuilder thinks so, and it's having success across the U.S. West.

item.title: Trump calls for the firing of Lisa Monaco, Microsoft president of global affairs
item.description: Fox Business anchor Maria Bartiromo brought up Monaco's position at Microsoft during her show. The appointment happened in July.

item.title: Not just for the ultra-wealthy: Two firms team up to create more access to private credit boom
item.description: Simplify Asset Management and VettaFi launched the actively managed Simplify VettaFi Private Credit Strategy ETF (PCR) on Wednesday.

item.title: Here are the most overbought stocks due for a decline. Intel leads the list
item.description: Intel shares may be getting a bit long in the tooth, at least near term.

item.title: From PepsiCo to Taco Bell, dirty soda is taking over
item.description: Dirty soda is fueling a resurgence in carbonated soft drinks, kicked off by Utah-based chain Swig and now extending to giant PepsiCo.

item.title: 36-year-old American Air Force vet moved to Vietnam, lives on $4,000 a month: You can 'focus on what makes you happy' here
item.description: Markeiz Ryan was in the U.S. Air Force for nine years before he moved to Vietnam in 2019.

item.title: Trump says he'll send troops to Portland, Oregon, in latest deployment to U.S. cities
item.description: President Donald Trump said Saturday he will send troops to Portland, Oregon, "authorizing Full Force, if necessary" to handle "domestic terrorists."

item.title: 'Spectacular' AI growth is creating a serious labor market problem for Fed, Jefferies' David Zervos warns
item.description: Long-time market bull David Zervos is worried the Federal Reserve is dangerously ignoring the artificial intelligence boom's fallout.

item.title: Forget the 60/40, here is what you need in your portfolio, says Bank of America’s Hartnett
item.description: Bank of America strategist Michael Hartnett breaks down his 25/25/25/25 portfolio and explains why it is performing better than the 60/40 this year.

item.title: BYD bids Warren Buffett's Berkshire an unfazed farewell: Selling is 'normal'
item.description: As it confirmed Berkshire has sold the last of its shares, the Chinese EV maker thanked Buffett and Munger for their 17-year investment.

item.title: Musk, Thiel, Bannon named in partially redacted Epstein documents released by Democrats
item.description: In partially redacted files released by House Democrats appeared the names of Elon Musk, Peter Thiel and Steve Bannon.

item.title: Anson Funds calls for Clear Channel Outdoor's sale. Here's why the timing may finally be right
item.description: The outdoor advertising company is now a U.S. pureplay, making it more focused and more valuable, and potentially easier to acquire.

item.title: This CEO is working to make a critical test for women's health more accessible: 'Even if the visit's free,' there are other barriers, she says
item.description: The rate of cervical cancer screenings fell during the Covid-19 pandemic, and haven't rebounded. Teal Health created the first FDA-approved, at-home screening.

item.title: Here's what to know about a federal government shutdown
item.description: The government previously shut down during President Donald Trump's first term over disputes about funding his planned U.S.-Mexico border wall.

item.title: Self-made millionaire: Ditch these 3 money beliefs that could be holding you back from earning more
item.description: Ramit Sethi has built a career sharing advice and working with individuals around how to make more money. He says these 3 beliefs hold too many people back.

item.title: The best AI customer service chatbots for businesses
item.description: The top AI chatbots offer businesses competitive pricing, free trial periods and tons of features.

item.title: If you regularly react this way, you probably look insecure to others, says psychology expert—here's what to do instead
item.description: You've likely heard of the fight, flight and freeze responses. But there is also a fourth, lesser known one: fawn. It can make you feel insecure, and make it harder to set healthy boundaries. Psychotherapist Meg Josephson shares some tips about how to handle it.

item.title: Miracle under threat: South Korea’s birth rate collapse could undo decades of growth
item.description: A shrinking population could lead to a permanent recession by the 2040s, according to the Bank of Korea.

item.title: Markets won't care if Trump fires Fed Governor Cook, DOJ tells Supreme Court
item.description: Governor Lisa Cook has urged the Supreme Court not to let President Donald Trump's attempt to fire her take effect while her lawsuit against him plays out.

item.title: Cramer's week ahead: Nonfarm payroll report, earnings from Paychex and Nike
item.description: CNBC's Jim Cramer on Friday told investors what to look out for next week on Wall Street.

item.title: Sinclair, Nexstar will bring 'Jimmy Kimmel Live' back to owned ABC stations on Friday
item.description: Broadcast station owners Sinclair and Nexstar will begin airing "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" after three days of preempting the program since its return.

item.title: The global wealthy are lining up for Trump's $1 million Gold Card after price cut
item.description: Advisors to the ultra-wealthy said their clients are keen to access the U.S. education system, health care system, banking system and financial markets.

item.title: Top Democrat slams Trump for attending Ryder Cup golf event as government shutdown looms
item.description: Congressional Democrats say Republicans and Trump will be to blame if the federal government shuts down next week because of lack of a stopgap funding deal.

item.title: Money manager Howard Rubin detained in sex trafficking case after feds cite hitman threat
item.description: Howard Rubin, an infamous money manager, was sued in 2017 by Playboy models and another woman who claimed they were beaten, sexually abused and raped.
